snippet: Rough-and-tumble campaign tactics are nothing new in New York politics, but a new proposal aims to identify and ban those behind the trash-talk ads.
abstract: New York City Councilman Daniel R Garodnick of Manhattan proposes legislation to control anonymous political campaign ads; bill would not ban attack ads altogether, but Campaign Finance Board would have to identify those responsible and fines could be imposed according to how widely the ads circulate.
lead_paragraph: Rough-and-tumble campaign tactics are nothing new in New York politics, but a new proposal aims to identify and ban those behind the trash-talk ads.

headline.main: Bill Would Put Face on Anonymous Attack Ads
headline.print_headline: Council Bill Would Put Face on Anonymous Attack Ads
